how do I tell what my xserver is?

You mean display manager. You are confused on your terms. A display manager is a tool managing user logins. X (server) is the core of any graphical interface. Finally, the desktop environment is all your panels and stuff, and the window manager is what draws window borders
Generally, ls /etc/init.d/*dm will give you your display manager's name
